title: Social-Education Integrated Instructional Design Simulation Workshop for 21st-Century Teacher Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, with foundational understanding of educational systems and societal changes
context.additional_context: A blended learning course for working professionals conducted outside work hours, utilizing digital simulations reflecting real corporate environments and social networks. Includes case studies integrating civic engagement and cultural diversity elements.

learning_goals: Analyze and explain the five core elements (creativity, critical thinking, collaboration, communication, digital literacy) of the 21st-century teacher competency framework from social and educational system perspectives.
Conduct learner needs analysis based on survey data → Design educational curriculum and establish instructional design strategies considering social relationships through a simulation process
Implement multicultural education scenarios in VR environments and derive improvement points through formative assessments to write a report
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
